meanings.definition: The quality of being brief and to the point.
meanings.sent1: Her essay stood out for its conciseness and clarity.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the conciseness of your explanation.
meanings.sent3: The conciseness of his speech left the audience wanting more.
meanings.sent4: In a world of verbosity, her conciseness was a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The conciseness of the recipe made it easy to follow.

meanings.definition: The act of expressing or stating something in a brief and clear manner.
meanings.sent1: His conciseness in delivering the news made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: The conciseness of the report saved us time.
meanings.sent3: The conciseness of his text messages always made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her conciseness in negotiations was like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The conciseness of the poem captured the essence perfectly.
